Background.text: Potassium chlorate, barium chlorate, and sodium chlorate found in fireworks, match heads, and weed killers

Mechanism_of_Toxicity.text:
Oxidizers and attackers of sulfhydryl groups
Cause methemoglobin formation

Oxidizers and attackers of sulfhydryl groups
Cause methemoglobin formation

Clinical_Presentation.text:
Abdominal pain
Vomiting
Diarrhea
Methemoglobinemia
Coagulopathy

Evaluation.text:
Co-oximetry
Additional evaluation based on clinical presentation and presence of methemoglobinemia
No specific serum levels are available

Management.text:
Activated charcoal
IS recommended
Methylene blue
for
methemoglobinemia
(1-2 mg/kg of 1% solution)
Sodium thiosulfate
IV may inactivate chlorate ions (anecdotal)
Hemodialysis
Supportive care

References.text: Olson, K. Poisoning and Drug Overdose, 1999.
